title: Sri Lanka stock market closed after index plunges over 10-pct
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s stock market closed for Tuesday after one of the indices plunged over 10 percent after it was halted twice as concerns over a 7 percent rate hike, the country suspending repayment of foreign debts, and sovereign credit rating downgrade weighed on investor sentiment.
The ASPI was 629.84 points down at 6,884.01 with the total trading was lated only less than 5 minutes for the day.

Most liquid index S&P SL20 also fell over 10 percent when the market closed for the day. The total turnover was nearly 800 million rupees with many investors have been trying to minimize losses as they expect further fall.
Trading was halted twice after the indices breached 5 percent and 7.5 percent fall circuit breakers.

The Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) was forced to close the market with less than five minutes of total trading on Monday as well after it opened following a two week break. The CSE closed the market citing investors need a cooling off period. Some investors have told Economy Next that they were not in favour of the decision.
The stock exchange has circuit breakers at 5.0 percent, 7.5 percent and 10.00 percent after which the market is closed. (Colombo/April26/2022)
